ygData.subject: Re: [archive-crawler] Downloading PDF files from a site using heritrix 3.0 [3 Attachments]
ygData.msgSnippet: There shouldn t be any problems getting PDFs or ZIPs using the default settings, unless they are at paths blocked by robots.txt rules, or on a separate

Subject: Re: [archive-crawler] Downloading PDF files from a site using heritrix
 3.0 [3 Attachments]
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=137285340; y=WGvawDwhThldCO6dYe_mvcqVwCeqG09BM5ClHLl38N_7
X-Yahoo-Profile: gojomo

There shouldn't be any problems getting PDFs or ZIPs using the default 
settings, unless they are at paths blocked by robots.txt rules, or on a 
separate hostname. (In either case small settings adjustments can ensure 
they're retrieved.)

Can you point out a specific URL that was downloaded, that links to a 
PDF that wasn't downloaded, so I can investigate further? (I found no 
PDF or ZIP outlinks on the URL <http://www.mf.gov.pl/index.php?const=6>.)

- Gordon @ IA

On 12/7/10 8:22 AM, Maciej Grela wrote:
> Hi,
>
> I am a novice user of Heritrix since we tried to use it in our
> activities during the Open Data Day (http://www.opendataday.org/) this
> year. The goal is to mirror a few government sites (one of them is
> this one: http://www.mf.gov.pl/index.php?const=6) in order to track
> changes, aggregate and index the information there. One feature of the
> websites is that they contain a lot of interesting PDF and ZIP files.
> Unfortunately, when I've tried to use heritrix-1.14.4 and heritrix-3.0
> to mirror the site, both versions didn't download the PDF and ZIP
> files. They are directly linked (no Javascript magic) and httrack was
> able to download them without any problems.
>
> Now the question is do we have to modify some of the default settings
> of heritrix to download PDFs ? I've read through the docs and the job
> description XML files (attached) and I didn't find anything obvious
> that would prevent the PDFs to be downloaded. Can you give me some
> pointers ?
>
>
> Best regards,
> Maciej Grela
>
